page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: {ROMAN RIVER VALLEY AND {LAYER-DE-LA-HAYE}- The valley covers about eight square miles of countryside to the south of Colchester.Great efforts have been made to safeguard the natural resources of the Roman River whilst satisfying the interests of agriculture,forestry,military training,sport and recreation.The village of Layer mentioned in the original Domesday Book has retained its identity despite its nearness to Colchester. The building of Abberton Reservoir brought about considerable changes in land ownership and usage during the 1930's.The Water Treatment Works helped to create new jobs in the area,and the Reservoir has provided increased opportunity for recreation.
